purpose.summary: Establish guidelines for handling changes to compensation plans, quotas, and participant circumstances that occur during an active performance period to ensure fairness to affected participants, business flexibility when needed, clear approval requirements, proper calculation and pro-ration, and minimization of mid-period changes.

appliesTo: Plan design changes (measures, formulas, caps, thresholds)
Participant status changes (promotions, demotions, transfers, leaves)

definitions.definition: Compensation plans should be stable and predictable. Plans designed and approved before period begins; mid-period changes minimized; changes made only when necessary for business reasons.
Do not change the rules after performance has occurred. Changes apply prospectively (from change date forward). Exception: Correcting company errors (may apply retroactively).

Changes should not unfairly penalize participants. If change reduces earnings potential, consider grandfathering or phase-in. If change due to company action (reorg, etc.), participant should be made whole.
Pro-rated quota calculation: (Old Quota x % of Year in Old Quota) + (New Quota x % of Year in New Quota).

provisions.title: Plan Design Changes
provisions.content: Changes to plan structure, measures, formulas, caps, thresholds, or other plan terms. STRONGLY DISCOURAGED.

subProvisions.title: When Permitted
subProvisions.content: Plan design changes are only permitted in limited circumstances. Approval Required: CRB (always).
items: Legal/regulatory requirement (must change to comply with law)
Significant business change (acquisition, product line discontinuation, etc.)
Plan error that is unsustainable (e.g., calculation error causing massive overpayment)

subProvisions.title: Participant Impact Mitigation
subProvisions.content: If change reduces earnings potential, consider mitigation options:
items: Grandfathering current participants (apply change to new hires only)
Phase-in over multiple periods
One-time transition payment to offset impact

provisions.title: Quota Changes
provisions.content: Changing individual quota assignment mid-period. DISCOURAGED but more common than plan design changes.

subProvisions.title: Permitted Reasons
subProvisions.content: Quota changes may be made for specific justified reasons.
items: Territory change
Promotion or role change
Organizational restructuring
Significant business change (lost major customer, gained major account)
Correction of error (quota set incorrectly)

subProvisions.title: NOT Permitted
subProvisions.content: Quota changes are not permitted for these reasons:
items: Performance-based (participant underperforming, so lower quota to make easier)
Favoritism or inequity
Retroactive change without justification

provisions.title: Mid-Period Quota Increase
provisions.content: When business opportunity increases and quota needs to be raised.

subProvisions.title: Option A: Increase Quota Pro-Rated
subProvisions.content: Increase quota pro-rated for remaining period. Blended Annual Quota = (Old period quota) + (New period quota).

subProvisions.title: Option B: Stretch Goal with Accelerator (Recommended)
subProvisions.content: Provide stretch goal with accelerator rather than raise base quota.
items: Keeps base quota stable
Rewards extra performance with accelerator
Easier to communicate

provisions.title: Mid-Period Quota Decrease
provisions.content: When territory is reduced, major customer is lost, or role scope is decreased. Pro-rate quota for remaining period.

subProvisions.title: Approval and Rationale
subProvisions.content: Approval: Sales VP + Compensation Manager + CRB (if decrease >25%). Must clearly explain why quota decreased.
items: Quota decreases can be perceived as making it easier
Must ensure decrease is justified (territory actually reduced, not helping underperformer)
Document evidence of scope reduction

provisions.title: Promotion or Role Change
provisions.content: Employee promoted mid-year to new role with different compensation plan.

subProvisions.title: Option A: Immediate Transition
subProvisions.content: Effective promotion date, switch to new plan. Old plan: Pro-rated for time in old role. New plan: Pro-rated for time in new role. Two separate calculations; two separate payments.

subProvisions.title: Option B: Deferred Transition
subProvisions.content: Complete current period on old plan. Start new plan at beginning of next period (e.g., next quarter or next year).

provisions.title: Organizational Restructuring
provisions.content: Division reorganization affects multiple participants. Case-by-case basis with CRB approval for plan changes.

subProvisions.title: Approach
subProvisions.content: Structured approach to organizational restructuring affecting compensation.
items: Assess Impact: How many participants affected? Nature of change? Projected financial impact?
Develop Transition Plan: Will quotas change? Will territories change? Will plan design change?
Grandfathering Consideration: If change disadvantages current participants, consider applying change to new hires or new period only
Communication Plan: Town hall or team meetings, individual meetings, written summary, Q&A support
CRB Approval: For plan changes and major organizational comp impacts

provisions.title: Quota Pro-Ration Methodology
provisions.content: Standard Pro-Ration Formula: Blended Annual Quota = (Old Quota x % of Year in Old Quota) + (New Quota x % of Year in New Quota).

subProvisions.title: Monthly vs. Annual Plans
subProvisions.content: Monthly Plans: If quota changes mid-month, pro-rate that month; subsequent months use new quota. Annual Plans: Pro-rate based on days in year.

provisions.title: Communication Requirements
provisions.content: All changes must be clearly communicated in advance with minimum notice periods.

subProvisions.title: Advance Notice
subProvisions.content: Minimum notice periods for different change types. Exception: Emergency changes may have shorter notice.
items: Plan design changes: 30 days
Quota changes: 15 days
Territory changes: 10 days (or as soon as known)

subProvisions.title: What to Communicate
subProvisions.content: For any mid-period change, communicate all relevant details.
items: What is changing: Plan, quota, territory, etc.
Why: Business rationale
When: Effective date
Impact: How this affects the participant (calculation examples)
Transition: What happens between now and effective date
Questions: Who to contact

subProvisions.title: Communication Methods
subProvisions.content: Methods vary by number of affected participants.
items: Individual Changes (1-10 people): One-on-one meeting followed by written confirmation
Group Changes (>10 people): Team meeting or town hall, individual follow-up, written FAQ, office hours for questions

provisions.title: Documentation Requirements
provisions.content: For all mid-period changes, proper documentation must be maintained. Retention: 7 years per Data Retention Policy.

provisions.title: Dispute Resolution
provisions.content: If participant disagrees with mid-period change, follow Dispute Resolution Procedures.

subProvisions.title: Resolution Process
subProvisions.content: Resolution approach for mid-period change disputes.
items: If change was properly approved and communicated, change stands
If error in process (e.g., insufficient notice), may delay effective date
If participant has valid concern, escalate to CRB

provisions.title: Best Practices
provisions.content: Guidelines for minimizing and managing mid-period changes effectively.

subProvisions.title: Minimize Mid-Period Changes
subProvisions.content: Strategies to reduce the need for mid-period changes.
items: Thorough planning before period begins
Annual planning process (quota setting, territory design, plan design)
Buffer in plans for expected changes (e.g., ramping quota for new hires)

subProvisions.title: Grandfather When Possible
subProvisions.content: If change is disadvantageous to current participants, consider applying change to new hires or new period only. Current participants continue on old terms until natural transition point.

subProvisions.title: Phase-In Major Changes
subProvisions.content: For significant changes, phase in over multiple periods to reduce shock and allow participants to adapt.

stateLaws: California: Limitations on retroactive changes to commission plans
State wage laws may restrict mid-period changes to commission plans
